analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni rdo rje gsung ngo//
translated: The emptiness of nature is VajravƒÅca.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni rdo rje las so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni rdo rje las so //
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic identity is Vajra.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ni rdo rje srung ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ni rdo rje srung ba'o //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is Vajra-Raksha.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ni rdo rje gnod sbyin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ni rdo rje gnod sbyin no //
translated: The emptiness of non-existence is Vajra-Yaksha.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni rdo rje mtshams sbyor ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni rdo rje mtshams sbyor ro //
translated: The emptiness of the intrinsic identity of non-existence is Vajra-Sandhi.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang phyin ci log gi chos re re'i gnyen po bdag dang gzhan du dmigs pa chos kyi sku'i ting nge 'dzin rgyun chen po dmigs pa med pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sgeg mo'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang phyin ci log gi chos re re'i gnyen po bdag dang gzhan du dmigs pa chos kyi sku'i ting nge 'dzin rgyun chen po dmigs pa med pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sgeg mo'i bdag nyid do //
translated: In the same way, here, the perfection of generosity, which is the concentration of the Dharma Body, the antidote to each of the mistaken phenomena, the great stream of the non-apprehension of self and other, is the nature of Lalita.

original: bdag dang gzhan du rlom sems med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phreng ba ma'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du rlom sems med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phreng ba ma'o //
translated: The perfection of morality, which is the absence of the conceit of self and other, is Malini.

original: dus thams cad du srog la bab kyang khro ba'i sems mi skye ba'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni glu mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du srog la bab kyang khro ba'i sems mi skye ba'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni glu mkhan ma'o //
translated: The perfection of patience, which is the non-arising of an angry mind even at the cost of one's life at all times, is Gita.

original: gnas skabs thams cad du bar chad med pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gar mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du bar chad med pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gar mkhan ma'o //
translated: The perfection of effort, which is uninterrupted in all circumstances, is the dancer.

original: de bzhin du rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bdug ba ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bdug ba ma'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom, which is free from conceptualization, is the incense bearer.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi rnam par g-yang ba thams cad dang bral ba'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni me tog ma'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi rnam par g-yang ba thams cad dang bral ba'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni me tog ma'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation, which is free from all internal and external distractions, is the flower bearer.

original: bsam pa phyin ci log gis bskyed pa'i smon lam ngan pa dang bral ba'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snang ba ma'o //üîΩthabs phyin ci log thams cad dang bral @62a * //
analyzed: bsam pa phyin ci log gis bskyed pa'i smon lam ngan pa dang bral ba'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snang ba ma'o // thabs phyin ci log thams cad dang bral @62a * //
translated: The perfection of aspiration, which is free from bad aspirations that are generated by wrong thoughts, is the light bearer.

original: ba'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dri chab ma'o //üîΩ'gro ba'i sdug bsngal la mngon par gzigs pa'i snying rje ni lcags kyu ma'o //
analyzed: ba'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dri chab ma'o // 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal la mngon par gzigs pa'i snying rje ni lcags kyu ma'o //
translated: The perfection of skillful means, which is free from all wrong skillful means, is the perfume bearer.üîΩCompassion, which looks upon the suffering of the world, is the iron hook.

original: de nyid sgrol ba la mngon par brtson pa'i byams pa ni zhags pa ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid sgrol ba la mngon par brtson pa'i byams pa ni zhags pa ma'o //
translated: Love, which is dedicated to the liberation of those who are looked upon, is the noose.

original: de dag la mngon par dgyes pa'i dga' ba ni lcags sgrog ma'o //
analyzed: de dag la mngon par dgyes pa'i dga' ba ni lcags sgrog ma'o //
translated: The joy of delighting in them is Lokeshvara.

original: thams cad du dmigs pa med pa'i btang snyoms chen po'i ting nge 'dzin ni dril bu ma'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad du dmigs pa med pa'i btang snyoms chen po'i ting nge 'dzin ni dril bu ma'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The samadhi of great equanimity, which is the absence of observation of all, is Ghantapa.üîΩThe way of the sambhogakaya is as follows.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa sku'i tshul ni gong du bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po rin po che thams cad kyi mchog lha dang mi rnams las khyad par du gyur pa chos kyi sku las byung bas ye shes lnga'i tshul dang / sprul pa'i skus 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas gdul bya'i sems can rnams gdul ba'i ched du rin po che'i gzhal yas khang na 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa sku'i tshul ni gong du bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po rin po che thams cad kyi mchog lha dang mi rnams las khyad par du gyur pa chos kyi sku las byung bas ye shes lnga'i tshul dang / sprul pa'i skus 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas gdul bya'i sems can rnams gdul ba'i ched du rin po che'i gzhal yas khang na 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: In order to tame the minds of sentient beings to be tamed by the five desirables, the Bhagavan Mahavairochana, who is the supreme of all jewels, who is superior to gods and humans, and who arises from the dharmakaya, is in the jeweled celestial mansion, which is complete with the five desirables.

original: theg pa chen po rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba nyid kyis longs spyod pa'i sangs rgyas 'ba' zhig nyid do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba nyid kyis longs spyod pa'i sangs rgyas 'ba' zhig nyid do //
translated: It is the sole enjoyment of the Buddha, the glorious Tantra of the Great Yoga of the Great Vehicle, the Purifier of All Evil Destinies.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched spangs pa las rnam par byang ba'i phung bo dang / khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid can du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched spangs pa las rnam par byang ba'i phung bo dang / khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid can du rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the characteristics of the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields of purification should be known as the abandonment of the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields of defilement.

original: de bas na ji srid sems kyi kun du rtog pa mtha' dag spangs pa nas /
analyzed: de bas na ji srid sems kyi kun du rtog pa mtha' dag spangs pa nas /
translated: Therefore, as long as all conceptualizations of the mind are abandoned,

original: de kho na nyid kun rtog gi bar du de kho na nyid la brten nas de'i ngo bo lhag par zhen pa'i phyir dang / de bas byung ba la brten te rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shes pa rdzogs pa las de rnams skye bar 'dod do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kun rtog gi bar du de kho na nyid la brten nas de'i ngo bo lhag par zhen pa'i phyir dang / de bas byung ba la brten te rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shes pa rdzogs pa las de rnams skye bar 'dod do //
translated: up to the reality of conceptualization, the reality is based on that, because of the excessive attachment to its essence, and because of the arising from that, the yogins' knowledge is complete, and it is asserted that they are born from that.

original: de ltar bdag nyid dang dngos po thams cad dbyer med par bltas te /
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid dang dngos po thams cad dbyer med par bltas te /
translated: Thus, having seen the identity of oneself and all things as inseparable,

original: gzugs la sogs pa thams cad yul med par gsal bas yul du byas nas bdag nyid la yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa thams cad yul med par gsal bas yul du byas nas bdag nyid la yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
translated: Since all forms and so forth are clearly non-existent as objects, one should make offerings to oneself, having taken them as objects.

original: de la gang dag gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong ba thams cad bkag nas bdag nyid la mchod pas mchog tu ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang dag gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong ba thams cad bkag nas bdag nyid la mchod pas mchog tu ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In this regard, if one were to make offerings to oneself by blocking all experiences of forms and so forth, how could that be supreme?

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: 'di ltar sems las ma gtogs pa'i gzhan du lha'i bdag nyid yod pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems las ma gtogs pa'i gzhan du lha'i bdag nyid yod pa ma yin pas na /
translated: In this way, since the nature of the deity does not exist as anything other than the mind,

original: bdag nyid kho na mchod par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kho na mchod par bya ba nyid do //
translated: it is oneself alone who is to be worshipped.

original: de bas na @62b sems las gzhan du mchod par bya ba gang yang med de /
analyzed: de bas na @62b sems las gzhan du mchod par bya ba gang yang med de /
translated: Therefore, there is nothing to be worshipped other than the mind.

original: sku gzugs la sogs pa yang rang gi sems kyis ltar bskyed pa'i btags pa tsam las gzhan du dngos po med pa nyid do //
analyzed: sku gzugs la sogs pa yang rang gi sems kyis ltar bskyed pa'i btags pa tsam las gzhan du dngos po med pa nyid do //
translated: Also, images and so forth are mere imputations generated by one's own mind, and nothing else exists as a thing.

original: de bas na bdag nyid lhar bskyed pa las dug med cing bla na med pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ni nges pa nyid de the tshom mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid lhar bskyed pa las dug med cing bla na med pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ni nges pa nyid de the tshom mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that one will attain the result, which is free from poison and unsurpassed, by generating oneself as the deity. One should have no doubt about this.

original: gang dag nyams su myong ba bkag pa las mi skye ba ni khyad par spyir zhugs pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: gang dag nyams su myong ba bkag pa las mi skye ba ni khyad par spyir zhugs pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúnot born from the cessation of experience‚Äù are a special case.

original: khyad par du bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a special case, it is not a universal.

original: yul gcig la ni byed pa 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul gcig la ni byed pa 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: The cessation of activity is in regard to one object,

original: yul sna tshogs la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul sna tshogs la ni ma yin no //
translated: not in regard to a variety of objects.

original: de la gang dag gi ngo bo yul du byed na ni yul sna tshogs par yang 'thad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang dag gi ngo bo yul du byed na ni yul sna tshogs par yang 'thad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the nature of the object is made into the object, then it is tenable in regard to a variety of objects.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: tshogs pa'i khyad par la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skye ba ni rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i khyad par la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skye ba ni rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: The arising of the desired result from a special collection is in accordance with the rule.

original: las gang las mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba ni dgag par bya ba'i yul yin zhing de'i ngo bo lhag par zhen pa tsam gyis ni thams cad du de ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: las gang las mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba ni dgag par bya ba'i yul yin zhing de'i ngo bo lhag par zhen pa tsam gyis ni thams cad du de ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The object to be stopped is the action from which an undesired result arises. The mere adherence to the nature of that is not in all cases like that.

original: dper na dug la sngags la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa zos kyang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i nus pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dug la sngags la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa zos kyang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i nus pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even though one eats poison that has been consecrated by a spell, it does not have the power to kill, etc.

original: lus kyi la sogs pa spyir yang bkag pa de dag kyang nges pa med de /
analyzed: lus kyi la sogs pa spyir yang bkag pa de dag kyang nges pa med de /
translated: In general, the body and so on are prohibited, but that is not definite.

original: 'di ltar snying rje la sogs pas bslang ba'i las kyis phyogs gzhan du mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ba'ang yod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar snying rje la sogs pas bslang ba'i las kyis phyogs gzhan du mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ba'ang yod de /
translated: Thus, there are other instances where the results of actions motivated by compassion and so on are undesirable.

original: kha cig tu tsha pa'i nad kyis btab pa rlung g-yab pa las de dang mi mthun pas gang zag de 'chi ba'i rgyu bskyed pa nyid dang / yang kha cig tu bud med kyi 'gro ba chu yis khyer ba la sa'i 'du shes kyis bton pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu tsha pa'i nad kyis btab pa rlung g-yab pa las de dang mi mthun pas gang zag de 'chi ba'i rgyu bskyed pa nyid dang / yang kha cig tu bud med kyi 'gro ba chu yis khyer ba la sa'i 'du shes kyis bton pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in some cases, a person afflicted by a hot disease dies from being fanned because that is incompatible with the disease, and in some cases, a woman who is carried away by water is rescued by the perception of earth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni snying rje la sogs pa dge ba yid la byed pa'i stobs kyis las gang dang gang byas pa thams cad gnang ba'i yul yin zhing byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni snying rje la sogs pa dge ba yid la byed pa'i stobs kyis las gang dang gang byas pa thams cad gnang ba'i yul yin zhing byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: But whatever actions bodhisattvas do, motivated by virtue such as compassion, are the domain of permission and are the defining characteristics of the bodhisattva path.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa bshad pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa bshad pa'i mdo las /
translated: This is stated in the sutra that explains the bodhisattva vows:

original: dge ba'i sems kyis byams bskyed nas //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems kyis byams bskyed nas //
translated: Having generated love with a virtuous mind,

original: snying rjes don gzhan ston pa la //
analyzed: snying rjes don gzhan ston pa la //
translated: and compassion for the sake of others,

original: gnang ba byin pas sdig mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gnang ba byin pas sdig mi 'gyur //
translated: there is no sin in giving permission.

original: zhes pa nas gzhan yang /üîΩbyang chub sems @63a * //üîΩdpa'i rtog pa yis //
analyzed: zhes pa nas gzhan yang / byang chub sems @63a * // dpa'i rtog pa yis //
translated: And further,

original: dge dang mi dge gang byas kyang //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge gang byas kyang //
translated: whatever virtue or nonvirtueüîΩis done by the imagination of a bodhisattva,

original: de dag yid kyi dbang byas phyir //
analyzed: de dag yid kyi dbang byas phyir //
translated: because it is under the power of the mind,

original: thams cad dge bar 'gyur ba yin //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad dge bar 'gyur ba yin // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: all of it becomes virtuous.

original: de bas na thabs mkhas pa ma yin pas kyang srog gcod pa las phyir ldog par gzhag par bya ste ;
analyzed: de bas na thabs mkhas pa ma yin pas kyang srog gcod pa las phyir ldog par gzhag par bya ste ;
translated: Therefore, even those who are not skilled in means should be established in turning away from killing,

original: thabs mkhas pa yin pa la gnang ba byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa yin pa la gnang ba byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who are skilled in means are given permission.

original: de yang 'di ltar rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa sum cu rtsa gsum pa las /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa sum cu rtsa gsum pa las /
translated: And this is stated in the VairocanƒÅbhisambodhi Tripi·π≠aka:

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis srog gcod pa las phyir ldog par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis srog gcod pa las phyir ldog par bya ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúHere bodhisattvas should turn away from killing,

original: ji srid dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa byed pa mthong ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa byed pa mthong ba'i bar du'o //
translated: as long as they see harm to the Three Jewels.

original: de bzhin du ma byin par len pa spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma byin par len pa spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Similarly, in order to abandon taking what is not given,

original: ji srid du ser sna can dag mthong ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid du ser sna can dag mthong ba'i bar du'o //
translated: until one sees those who are miserly.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i dbang gis gzhan gyi bud med spyad par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i dbang gis gzhan gyi bud med spyad par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, one should not engage in sexual intercourse with the wives of others out of desire,

original: ji srid gter la sogs pa ster ba'i par du'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ji srid gter la sogs pa ster ba'i par du'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: until one gives away one‚Äôs own wife and so on.

original: de dag la sogs pa bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad ni gzhan du 'ang rgyas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad ni gzhan du 'ang rgyas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should consult the scriptures for the details of all the precepts, such as these.

original: yang 'dir rnyed pa la sogs pas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las ni mi dge ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang 'dir rnyed pa la sogs pas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las ni mi dge ba nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, the actions of body, speech, and mind that are motivated by gain and so on are nonvirtuous,

original: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ster ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ster ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they give rise to undesirable results.

original: de la de'i rang gi ngo bo ni lung du ma bstan pa yin zhing gang du gzhan la phan par byed pa'i bsam pa las byung ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i rang gi ngo ba yin te bla na med pa'i 'bras bu 'dren par byed pa'i
analyzed: de la de'i rang gi ngo bo ni lung du ma bstan pa yin zhing gang du gzhan la phan par byed pa'i bsam pa las byung ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i rang gi ngo ba yin te bla na med pa'i 'bras bu 'dren par byed pa'i
translated: The nature of these actions is indeterminate, but when they arise from the intention to benefit others, they are the nature of the bodhisattva‚Äôs training, because they lead to the highest result.

original: phyir ro // yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni bdag nyid kyi spyod pas yongs su spyod pa la ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par mi 'gyur te de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa las /
analyzed: phyir ro // yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni bdag nyid kyi spyod pas yongs su spyod pa la ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par mi 'gyur te de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa las /
translated: Moreover, when bodhisattvas enjoy themselves with their own behavior, they do not incur any fault. The Perfection of Wisdom in Seven Hundred Lines says:

original: chos dang yon tan byang chub lung bstan shes gyur pa //
analyzed: chos dang yon tan byang chub lung bstan shes gyur pa //
translated: Those who know the Dharma, its qualities, and the prediction of awakening

original: de ni tshul khrims nor dang chos dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims nor dang chos dang yang dag ldan //
translated: Are endowed with the wealth of ethics and the Dharma.

original: gang zhig chos dang byang chub yon tan smod byed pa//
analyzed: gang zhig chos dang byang chub yon tan smod byed pa//
translated: Those who disparage the Dharma and the qualities of awakening

original: de ni gtso bo'i tshul khrims 'chal zhes rab tu bshad //
analyzed: de ni gtso bo'i tshul khrims 'chal zhes rab tu bshad //
translated: Are said to be the worst violators of ethics.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo chen po las kyang thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa dag gis dngos po thams cad smad par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo chen po las kyang thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa dag gis dngos po thams cad smad par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the noble Great S≈´tra on the Immeasurables says, ‚ÄúThose who are skilled in means should not disparage anything.‚Äù

original: de la 'dir gzugs la @63b sogs pa'i yul rang gi bsam pas longs spyod par mtshungs kyang /
analyzed: de la 'dir gzugs la @63b sogs pa'i yul rang gi bsam pas longs spyod par mtshungs kyang /
translated: Here, although it is the same in that you enjoy objects such as forms according to your own wishes,

original: kha na tho ba dang kha na ma tho ba med pa'i 'bras bur rnam par gzhag bar bya ste /
analyzed: kha na tho ba dang kha na ma tho ba med pa'i 'bras bur rnam par gzhag bar bya ste /
translated: The result of the absence of remorse and the result of the absence of regret should be understood as the result of the absence of what is reprehensible and the absence of what is not reprehensible.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bsam bas ni nyon mongs pa'i yul la spyod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bsam bas ni nyon mongs pa'i yul la spyod do //
translated: One engages in the object of defilement through the intention of defilement.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa med par longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa med par longs spyod pa'o //

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'bras bur mthun pa dang / rang mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bur mthun pa dang bla na med pa'i 'bras bur mthun pa'o //
translated: in conformity with the result of the mundane, in conformity with the result of personal liberation, and in conformity with the unsurpassed result.

original: de la dang po ni mtho ris la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pas lha la sogs pa la mchod pa'i nges par 'byung ba yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni mtho ris la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pas lha la sogs pa la mchod pa'i nges par 'byung ba yid la byed pa'o //

analyzed: gnyis pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du gzugs la sogs pa la nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pas so sor rtog pa ste /
translated: The second is the discernment of form, etc. through the aspect of renunciation for the sake of the enlightenment of the sravaka, etc.

original: ji ltar yang dag pa mtshungs par ldan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag pa mtshungs par ldan pa'i mdo las /
translated: As the Samyuktabhidharmahydaya says:

original: dge slong dag 'dir gang mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba na gzugs de dag nye bar dmigs par mi bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i bar la gnas te /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'dir gang mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba na gzugs de dag nye bar dmigs par mi bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i bar la gnas te /

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar dmigs par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //

original: gsum pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /

analyzed: smon lam gyi stobs kyis rnam par grol ba bsgom pa dang de kho na nyid 'ba' zhig la so sor rtog pas bsgom pa dang / bdag med pa tsam la dmigs pas bsgom pa dang / zab cing rgya che ba la bsgom pa'o //
translated: cultivation of liberation through the power of vows, cultivation of discernment of reality alone, cultivation of the mere objective selflessness, and cultivation of the profound and the vast.

original: de la dang po ni gzugs la sogs pa 'di ltar snang zhing nyams su myong ba rnams kyi rjes su 'brangs te 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan par byed ba'i sems mngon du bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni gzugs la sogs pa 'di ltar snang zhing nyams su myong ba rnams kyi rjes su 'brangs te 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan par byed ba'i sems mngon du bsgom pa ste /
translated: The first is the cultivation of the realization of the mind that benefits all beings by following after the appearance and experience of these forms, etc.

original: ji ltar spyod yul yongs su dag pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji ltar spyod yul yongs su dag pa'i mdo las /
translated: As the S≈´tra on the Purification of the Range of Activity says:

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gnas gang du gzugs yid du 'ong ba dag ma thong na /

analyzed: sems can thams cad 'di 'dra ba'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las thar bar gyur cig ces pa de ltar sems bskyed par bya ba dang / gnas gang du btang snyoms kyi gzugs mthong ba na / sems @64a * //
translated: And when they see unpleasant forms, they should think, ‚ÄúMay all living beings be freed from the suffering of samsara, which is like this!‚ÄùüîΩAnd when they see neutral forms, they should think, ‚ÄúMay all living beings attain the state of equanimity!‚ÄùüîΩAnd so it is said at length.

original: can thams cad sems mnyam pa nyid du gyur cig ces de ltar sems bskyed par bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du mdo sde rgyan las kyang /
analyzed: can thams cad sems mnyam pa nyid du gyur cig ces de ltar sems bskyed par bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du mdo sde rgyan las kyang /
translated: And in the Sutralamkara,

analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul sna tshogs ji lta ji lta bar //
translated: Whatever sense objects they may be,

analyzed: de ltar de ltar rig pas mnyam nyid go 'phang la//
translated: In all of them the wise will findüîΩThe state of perfect equanimity.

original: sems can rnams la phan pas mngon par 'du byed cing //üîΩsnying rje'i bdag nyid zhugs pas spyod yul yongs su brjod //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pas mngon par 'du byed cing // snying rje'i bdag nyid zhugs pas spyod yul yongs su brjod //

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

original: gnyis pa ni sems can gyi khams la snying rjes rnam par bltas te bdag med pa la so sor rtog pa yid la byed pas yul mtha' dag la nye bar longs spyod pa nyid do /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sems can gyi khams la snying rjes rnam par bltas te bdag med pa la so sor rtog pa yid la byed pas yul mtha' dag la nye bar longs spyod pa nyid do /
translated: The second is the enjoyment of all objects by the bodhisattva who has compassionately surveyed the realm of sentient beings and who has the mental orientation of the discernment of selflessness.üîΩThe Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines says,

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi khri lnga stong pa las rigs kyi bu chos smra ba'i dge slong de la bdud sdig can bar chad bya ba'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams kyi stobs
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi khri lnga stong pa las rigs kyi bu chos smra ba'i dge slong de la bdud sdig can bar chad bya ba'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams kyi stobs
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, in order to create obstacles for the monk who is a Dharma teacher, MƒÅra, the evil one, will use the power of pleasant forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and touchables

analyzed: te / de la thabs mkhas pa'i shes rab kyis bshigs  nas yongs su longs spyod par bya'o zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: and the bodhisattva should destroy them with the wisdom of skillful means and enjoy them.‚Äù

original: de bas na de kho na nyid yid la byed pa ni nyes pa mtha' dag gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de kho na nyid yid la byed pa ni nyes pa mtha' dag gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since attention to reality is the antidote to all faults,

analyzed: gang du mi 'dod pa'i las skyes pa rnams kyang de kho na nyid la so sor rtog pas zad par 'gyur te ;

analyzed: de'i dbang gis mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa la gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: gang la so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa yongs su shes pa de la nyon mongs pa dang las kyi sgrib pa ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa yongs su shes pa de la nyon mongs pa dang las kyi sgrib pa ji ltar 'gyur te /

original: de yang mdo sde rgyan las /
analyzed: de yang mdo sde rgyan las /
translated: And the Ornament of the MahƒÅyƒÅna S≈´tras says:

analyzed: gang la 'jig rten du mar snang bar 'dod pa min //

original: skyes bus chags par bltas pa 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: skyes bus chags par bltas pa 'dod pa ste //

original: sna tshogs de yis 'khor bar gnas 'gyur bas //
analyzed: sna tshogs de yis 'khor bar gnas 'gyur bas //

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' 'dul bar 'dod pa yin //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' 'dul bar 'dod pa yin // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gsum pa ni bdag med pa las dmigs pa nyid kho nas gzugs la sogs pa'i tha mal gyi ngo bo la lhag par zhen pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The third is the antidote to the ordinary nature of form, etc.,üîΩsince it is the cause that makes one abide in the state of perfect buddhahood through the process of higher and higher stages, and it is the pride that experiences form, etc.,

original: des ni gong @64b nas gong du brgyud pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang la gnas par byed pa'i rgyu yin zhing yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshul ji lta ba bzhin du nga rgyal gyis gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myongüîΩbar 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: des ni gong @64b nas gong du brgyud pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang la gnas par byed pa'i rgyu yin zhing yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshul ji lta ba bzhin du nga rgyal gyis gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba nyid do //

original: de la gang dag 'di skad du de lta na ni gang zag de dus yun ring bzhig na nges par 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang gi ngo bo ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang dag 'di skad du de lta na ni gang zag de dus yun ring bzhig na nges par 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang gi ngo bo ma yin no zhe na /

original: de lta na tha mal du longs spyod pa 'ang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na tha mal du longs spyod pa 'ang med par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, even the experience of the ordinary would not exist,

original: de kho na nyid la gang zag la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la gang zag la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in reality there are no persons, etc.

original: de la ji ltar lhag par zhen pas gzugs la sogs pa mthong ngo zhes yul du byed pa dang / de kho na nyid la ni gzugs la sogs pa med par ni sngar smras zin to //

translated: As for the object, it is said that one sees form, etc. by way of the adherence to them. But in reality, form, etc. do not exist, as was previously stated.

original: de bas na lhag par zhen pa ni de kho na nyid la ltos pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na lhag par zhen pa ni de kho na nyid la ltos pa med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the adherence to them does not depend on reality.

analyzed: gzhan du skyes bu mchog gi don du sbyor ba ni dag bar bcom ldan 'das kyi gzhung du mthong ngo /

original: de bas na de'i ming tsam gyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi nga rgyal bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na de'i ming tsam gyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi nga rgyal bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, one should have the pride of Buddhahood even by the mere name of that.

original: da ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs ba'i byang chub kyi rgyur bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: da ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs ba'i byang chub kyi rgyur bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Now, the Lord has established the cause of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de bas na thams cad bdag nyid kyis nye bar longs spyod pas ni dge ba'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ni rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad bdag nyid kyis nye bar longs spyod pas ni dge ba'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ni rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /

analyzed: de ni bsam pa'i dbang gis dge ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /

original: de yang dkon mchog bkod pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de yang dkon mchog bkod pa'i mdo las /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis stong phrag brgyad cu re re la yang dge slong stong phrag brgyad cu'i 'khor dang bcas pa la bskal ba du mar bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis bkur sti byas pa bas /
translated: Compared to a bodhisattva who for many eons honors with all articles of happiness a hundred thousand arhats, each with a retinue of a hundred thousand arhats,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gang zhig gis dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir bdag nyid rnam par dag pas longs spyod par byed pa ni sngar gyi byang chub sems dpa' bas ches bsod nams khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: a bodhisattva who enjoys himself with pure wealth for the sake of upholding the true Dharma generates far greater merit than the former bodhisattva.

original: yang 'dir bzhi pas btsal bar bya ba'i bde bar gshegs pa'i @65a * //
analyzed: yang 'dir bzhi pas btsal bar bya ba'i bde bar gshegs pa'i @65a * //
translated: Also, here, the one who is to be sought by the fourth is the Sugata.üîΩ

original: sku'i bdag nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral ba yin te /üîΩ'di ltar 'od zer dpag tu med pa'i tshogs 'byung zhing sprul pa sna tshogs bkye bas 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin gyi gzugs la sogs pa thams cad de'i ngo bor mthong zhing sngar smras pa'i rnam pas dngos po mtha'
analyzed: sku'i bdag nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral ba yin te / 'di ltar 'od zer dpag tu med pa'i tshogs 'byung zhing sprul pa sna tshogs bkye bas 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin gyi gzugs la sogs pa thams cad de'i ngo bor mthong zhing sngar smras pa'i rnam pas dngos po mtha'
translated: Moreover, the nature of the Sugata‚Äôs body, which is to be sought by means of the fourth, is naturally free from the stain of conceptual thought.üîΩThus, it is endowed with the ability to act for the welfare of all beings, since it emits a multitude of immeasurable light rays and emanations.

original: dag mnyam pa nyid du lta bar byed de /
analyzed: dag mnyam pa nyid du lta bar byed de /
translated: But one should not see all forms and so on as its essence, and one should not view all things as sameness in the manner stated previously,

original: phan tshun du ltos pa med pas rang gi ngo bo la bsgrub pa mngon du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun du ltos pa med pas rang gi ngo bo la bsgrub pa mngon du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one observes the establishment of its own nature, since it is not mutually dependent.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad kyis bdag med pa'i sku la mchod pas sangs rgyas la mchod par ji ltar 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa ni kha na mtho ba'i rgyun chen por 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad kyis bdag med pa'i sku la mchod pas sangs rgyas la mchod par ji ltar 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa ni kha na mtho ba'i rgyun chen por 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, how could worship of the Buddha be accomplished by worship of the body of the Buddha with all the sense objects such as form, etc.?

original: de bas na de dag ni tha mal gyi gnas skabs phyin ci log yid la byed pa'i gnyen po lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni tha mal gyi gnas skabs phyin ci log yid la byed pa'i gnyen po lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the practice of the training in superior morality is the antidote to the mistaken mental activity of the ordinary state.

original: mig la sogs pa'i yul rnams la bden pa ma yin pa yid la byed pa spangs pas mchog gi mya ngan 'das pa thob cing don chen po bla na med pa'i sdom pa ste /

translated: By abandoning the mental activity of unreality with regard to the objects of the eyes, etc., one attains supreme nirvana and the great purpose, the unexcelled vow.

original: mig la sogs pa'i yul thams cad la'ang phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lhar bskyed par bya zhing /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i yul thams cad la'ang phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lhar bskyed par bya zhing /

original: de'i sngags dang phyag rgyas dag par bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: de'i sngags dang phyag rgyas dag par bya ba nyid de /
translated: One should purify them with their mantras and seals.

original: de yang mdo sde nyis brgya lnga bcu pa las kyang /
analyzed: de yang mdo sde nyis brgya lnga bcu pa las kyang /

original: mig gi sdom pa legs pa ste //
analyzed: mig gi sdom pa legs pa ste //

analyzed: rna ba'i sdom pa'ang legs pa yin // sna yi sdom pa legs pa ste //

original: lce yi sdom pa legs pa yin //
analyzed: lce yi sdom pa legs pa yin //

original: yid kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
analyzed: yid kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //

original: kun du bsdams pa'i dge slong ni //
analyzed: kun du bsdams pa'i dge slong ni //

analyzed: sdug bsngal kun las rab tu grol // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is completely liberated from all suffering.

original: de bas na rang dang gzhan thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su dmigs pa nyid kyis byang chub kyi bslab pa sems kyi bslab pa rang gi ngo bo dang / rang gi ngo bo la phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa nyid kyi bslab pa shes rab kyi bslab pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na rang dang gzhan thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su dmigs pa nyid kyis byang chub kyi bslab pa sems kyi bslab pa rang gi ngo bo dang / rang gi ngo bo la phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa nyid kyi bslab pa shes rab kyi bslab pa nyid do //
